1.title: Episode #1.1
1.plot: In this episode, we'll introduce you to HYMIE SCKOLNICK who opened the iconic Beauty's diner in the early 1940's; to EUNICE SEBASTIAO, a Brazilian nanny whose fate unexpectedly brought her to Montreal; to DAVE ARNOLD, the cynical painter who calls himself Mr. Sign; and to a young Iranian couple who opened a cozy caf√© to connect them back to home.

2.title: Episode #1.2
2.plot: In today's episode, you'll meet HOLLY GAUTHIER-FRANKEL, an accomplished actor and burlesque dancer who calls herself MISS SUGARPUSS. And STEPEN CHIN who grew up in war-torn Singapore, but whose passion for piano took him around the world.

3.title: Episode #1.3
3.plot: In this episode, we'll introduce you to JAM RAHMOUNI, the city's most notorious night club physiognomist; MANDY and REBECCA WOLFE, two sisters and best friends who run a successful salad bar empire; CYRILLE ESTEVE, the hard-working SPOONMAN and fixture outside Ogilvy's department store; and FARIBA LALIBERTE, a globe-trotting storyteller and talented painter.

4.title: Episode #1.4
4.plot: In today's episode, you'll meet DAVID BLOOM, proprietor of popular Sumac restaurant; AMANY RADWAN, an Middle East journalist who worked for Time Magazine, JOSH SILVER, the city's celebrity man-about-town; and FRANK PAPAGEORGIOU, the entertaining owner of Victoria Fish Market.

5.title: Episode #1.5
5.plot: In this episode, we'll introduce you to NILUFAR AL-SHOURBAJI, the most friendliest, super chill restaurateur you'll ever meet; JEAN-PAUL LABELLE, a mechanical parts sculptor with a unique take on art; and TAMEY LAU, the eccentric Dragon Flowers shop owner of Mile End.

6.title: Episode #1.6
6.plot: In today's episode, you'll meet MAGED TARABOULSY, the legendary proprietor of Lapidarius - one of the city's finest antique shops; ROB CALLARD, the dedicated owner of Chez Nick - the oldest restaurant in Montreal, which will soon be celebrating an astonishing 100 years in business; and VIVIANNE SILVER, a journaler, a social worker, and a mother of three (3) successful men, as we follow her on her journey before she embarks on a life-changing move.

7.title: Episode #1.7
7.plot:

8.title: Episode #1.8
8.plot: In today's episode, you'll meet DR. MADAN BALI, the trail-blazing yogi who helped introduce the practice of yoga and mindful meditation to Canada; PATRICK ARMEN, founder of The Centered Man Project that successfully transforms men with confidence issues; and, KAZUO AKUTSU, owner of Kazu - Montreal's most recognized Japanese restaurant, known for its authentic and innovative food.

imdb.plot outline: Montreal is an incredible melting pot of cultures from around the world, and behind every culture are real people with real stories. In time to celebrate the city's upcoming 375th Anniversary, this series explores the fascinating people that make up the intricate cultures and sub-cultures of Montreal. MONTREALERS focuses on the art of conversation, creating an environment of open dialogue; for both the interviewee and the viewer. With characters from an array of backgrounds, including Greek, Indian, Brazilian, Japanese, Egyptian, Iranian, and French - MONTREALEARS is an all-inclusive show that gives all voices meaning. Each episode features personal stories on immigration, love, identity, struggle, culture and tradition.
imdb.title: Montrealers
plot: In this intimate interview series, Leah Balass sits down with Montreal's most colorful personalities to uncover their captivating life stories and to celebrate the various cultures that make up this unique city.

Montreal is an incredible melting pot of cultures from around the world, and behind every culture are real people with real stories. In time to celebrate the city's upcoming 375th Anniversary, this series explores the fascinating people that make up the intricate cultures and sub-cultures of Montreal. MONTREALERS focuses on the art of conversation, creating an environment of open dialogue; for both the interviewee and the viewer. With characters from an array of backgrounds, including Greek, Indian, Brazilian, Japanese, Egyptian, Iranian, and French - MONTREALEARS is an all-inclusive show that gives all voices meaning. Each episode features personal stories on immigration, love, identity, struggle, culture and tradition.
